III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
The agency is located in leased office space in downtown Port Huron. The agency
occupies ample space, which includes a lobby/waiting area; two rooms used for family
visitation, which contain toys and games, as well as a video camera for monitoring visits
by the worker from the next room; a conference room, a training room, staff offices, and
storage space. The agency has the option of leasing space on the second floor of the
building should the need for additional space arise. Employee and client records are
locked and stored securely in locking cabinets, inside locking offices. Fire extinguishers
are located in the building. A parking lot with ample space for both staff and clients is
located behind the building.
B. Program Description
The agency will operate the following three programs:
• Foster Home Certification: The agency will recruit, train, and perform certification
functions for foster homes located in Macomb, St. Clair, Lapeer and Sanilac
Counties. The agency will recruit foster homes for children from birth through 17
years, with a variety of issues and special needs, including teen mothers and
sibling groups. The agency has developed program statements, policies, and
procedures for the certification program, which are compliant with applicable
licensing rules and statutes.
• Foster Care: The agency will place and supervise children in foster care, of all
ages, who exhibit a wide variety of behavioral or emotional difficulties, in addition
to those who may not. The agency will partner with other child placing agencies
and the court to work toward permanency for children placed in foster care. In
addition to foster care case management services; behavior modification and
therapy will also be provided for youth in foster care where needed. The agency
has developed program statements, policies and procedures for the foster care
program, which are compliant with applicable licensing rules and statutes.
• Adoption: The agency will evaluate applicants for adoption, place children into
adoptive homes, will supervise adoptive placements when necessary; and will
provide adoption services for children of all ages. The agency will provide
adoption services for both applicants who are foster parents, as well as those
who are not. The agency will facilitate and complete adoptions for children who
2

are in foster care with the agency, who are referred for adoption by other
agencies, or who are available for adoption through the Michigan Adoption
Resource Exchange (MARE). The agency has developed program statements,
policies, and procedures, explaining requirements for adoption, fees, and
services provided; which are compliant with applicable licensing rules and
statutes.
The agency’s policies and procedures have been reviewed, and have been found to be
compliant with rules and statutes. The agency will operate with a Chief Administrator, a
Program Director, one Supervisor, Two Foster Care Case Managers, one Certification
Worker, and a Receptionist. All staff have been hired and are in place, with the
exception of the Supervisor, who has been hired, however has not begun work yet.
Employee records have been reviewed for all employees, with the exception of the
Supervisor; which will be reviewed at the renewal inspection. The agency will operate
financially as a part of the overall budgetary structure of Ennis Center for Children, Inc.
The annual budget and financial audit for the organization was reviewed, and no
concerns were noted. The agency will receive per diem rates for children placed into
foster care, as well as payments for adoptions completed; from their contracted referral
source.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
There are no violations.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend issuance of a provisional license to this child placing agency, private.
